titles.title: Expressing the sense of the House of Representatives that the President of the United States should take Executive action to declare National COVID-19 Vaccination Awareness Day as a one-time Federal holiday to act as a galvanizing moment to promote the more rapid distribution of COVID-19 vaccines to all areas of the country, show appreciation for the heroic partnership between government and health care stakeholders to develop effective and safe vaccines in record time, and increase public awareness of the important role vaccination can play for a return to normalcy as soon as possible.

bill.summary: This resolution calls on the President to declare National COVID-19 Vaccination Awareness Day as a one-time federal holiday and encourages other efforts to promote COVID-19 (i.e., coronavirus disease 2019) vaccinations.
